_header: Pride pride woe thou be mater visiorum
_description: Against Pride and Flaunting Manners — twenty macaronic lines in couplets

DublinNatLib1435.First Lines:
Pryd pryd wo thow be mater uisyorumLucifer alas for the
                        gaudia polorum…
DublinNatLib1435.Last Lines:
…He putth hyt hand in hys powrs cum nichyll intus
                    fueratHe ffownd none þer saw godeys cowrs hoc non sibi
                        deerat
DublinNatLib1435.Editions:
Seymour,  St. John Delincourt. 
             “Three Medieval Poems from Kilkenny.” 
             Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy
         41(c) (1932-33): 205-9: 207.

PROC4734112.Transcription:
Pryde pryde wo thow be mater uisyorumLucifer has lost [ ]ia
                        gaudiorumLucifer was f[ ]i polorumBot for pride he fal
                    [ ]vala saculorum…
PROC4734112.Note: Portions illegible due to water damage and wear.
